content: recommended changes to the system are described:  Enable z/VM FTP and Network File System functionality  Reconfigure TCP/IP for high availability by using a VSWITCH The main TCP/IP configuration file is the PROFILE TCPIP file and it is on the TCPMAINT 198 disk, which is accessed as the D disk. 6.8.1 Enabling z/VM FTP and Network File System functions Enable both the FTP and Network File System (NFS) functions by completing the following steps: 1. Log on to TCPMAINT by using the password that you set for service machines in section 10.2.1, “Changing default passwords” on page 310. 2. Make a backup copy of the TCP/IP configuration file, PROFILE TCPIP D: ===> copy profile tcpip d = tcpiorig = (olddate 3. Edit the TCP/IP configuration file: ===> xedit profile tcpip d 4. Make the following changes: a. Locate the last line that begins with OBEY and move your cursor into the prefix area beside the line underneath that begins with OPERATOR. b. Enter I in the prefix area and press Enter to
